page.title: 10T.RUSHTON HOUSES (PART 1)
page.content:
TYPES OF HOUSES SEEN IN TARRANT RUSHTON {THATCHED COTTAGES {STONE AND BRICK COTTAGES {OLD PEOPLES FLATS {BRICK COTTAGES
{THATCHED COTTAGES}BUILT OVER 350 YEARS AGO. WALLS CONSTRUCTED OF CHALK MIXED WITH WATER WITH STRAW, TWIGS, AND FIR-CONES. THIS WAS LEFT TO DRY. HEIGHT OF WALLS DECIDED BY HEIGHT OF HOUSE-HOLDER. THE ROOF WAS THATCH. SHIPS TIMBERS USED FOR SUPPORTING CEILINGS. FIRE WAS & IS,THE MAIN ENEMY OF THATCH. ONCE THE CHALK WALLS ARE EXPOSED TO RAIN & FROST RAPID DETERIORATION OCCURS. {STONE & BRICK COTTAGES}- 150 YEARS AGO THE LAND-OWNER OF TARRANT RUSHTON WAS APPALLED AT THE CONDITIONS OF HOUSING. HE BUILT PAIRS OF STONE & BRICK COTTS.
